io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock

Class YahooStockDownloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.stock.YahooStockDownloader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StockDownloader

    @ThreadSafe
public final class YahooStockDownloader
extends java.lang.Object
implements StockDownloader
    Implemented StockDownloader utilizing Yahoo!Finance's online service to acquire stock data. This class downloads both detailed field data and an extended history of the stock.

    SUPPORTED STOCK FIELDS: This downloader only supports the following fields. All names for these fields are constant values in the AbstractStock class. Using any fields that are not listed here in with the downloadStockDetails() method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

    ASK
    ASK_SIZE
    AVERAGE_DAILY_VOLUME
    BID
    CHANGE
    CHANGE_IN_PERCENT
    CHANGE_50_DAY_AVG
    CHANGE_50_DAY_AVG_PERCENT
    CHANGE_200_DAY_AVG
    CHANGE_200_DAY_AVG_PERCENT
    CHANGE_YEAR_HIGH
    CHANGE_YEAR_HIGH_PERCENT
    CHANGE_YEAR_LOW
    CHANGE_YEAR_LOW_PERCENT
    CURRENT_PRICE
    CURRENCY
    DAYS_HIGH
    DAYS_LOW
    DAYS_RANGE
    FIFTY_DAY_AVG
    LAST_TRADE_DATE
    LAST_TRADE_SIZE
    LAST_TRADE_TIME
    MARKET_CAPITALIZATION
    NAME
    OPEN
    PREVIOUS_CLOSE
    REVENUE
    SYMBOL
    TWO_HUNDRED_DAY_AVG
    VOLUME
    YEAR_HIGH
    YEAR_LOW
    YEAR_RANGE

    THREAD SAFETY: This class has no mutable state. All variables are either static and final, or local and confined to the individual thread stack. Therefore any instance of this class can be successfully used in a concurrent environment.

    Version:
    2.3
    Author:
    craig

    • Method Detail

      • downloadStockDetails

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> downloadStockDetails(java.lang.String symbol,
                                                                             java.lang.String[] fields)
                                                                      throws InvalidStockException,
                                                                             java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                                             java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: StockDownloader
        Downloads detailed data on a stock and returns it in a Map collection. Accepts the stock's marketplace symbol and an array of names of the fields to be downloaded.

        The field names should be the constant values found in the AbstractStock class to maintain consistency. Implementations should not be bound to utilize each and every constant that exists, however if it does not there should be a check on the field names provided to ensure that they are supported. If they are not supported, an IllegalArgumentException should be thrown.

        In addition, the stock should be checked early on to ensure that it is a legitimate stock on the market. If it is not, an InvalidStockException should be thrown.

        Additional exceptions may be thrown based on various errors that may occur during execution. Implementing classes should document these exceptions so they can be anticipated.

        Specified by:
        downloadStockDetails in interface StockDownloader
        Parameters:
        symbol - the stock's marketplace symbol.
        fields - an array of constant values from the AbstractStock class defining the fields this class should download data for.
        Returns:
        a Map containing the data for the requested fields for the stock.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if the stock is not a legitimate marketplace stock.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web service.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download data from the web service.
        See Also:
        AbstractStock

      • downloadStockHistory

        public java.util.List<HistoricalQuote> downloadStockHistory(java.lang.String symbol,
                                                            int months)
                                                     throws InvalidStockException,
                                                            java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                            java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: StockDownloader
        Downloads the history of this stock, and returns it as a list of HistoricalQuote objects. The time period to get the history for is defined by a number of months passed as a parameter.

        The stock should be checked early on to ensure that it is a legitimate stock on the market. If it is not, an InvalidStockException should be thrown.

        Additional exceptions may be thrown based on various errors that may occur during execution. Implementing classes should document these exceptions so they can be anticipated.

        Specified by:
        downloadStockHistory in interface StockDownloader
        Parameters:
        symbol - the stock's marketplace symbol.
        months - the number of months to download history for.
        Returns:
        a list of HistoricalQuotes for the history of the stock.
        Throws:
        InvalidStockException - if the stock is not a legitimate marketplace stock.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if a connection cannot be made to the web service.
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs while trying to download data from the web service.
